entries.title: Brazilian President Vows to Rein In Military After Riots
entries.description: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva vowed to reduce the influence of military forces in his government after blaming security officials for aiding protesters who stormed the presidential palace.

entries.title: ConocoPhillips in Talks to Sell Venezuelan Oil in U.S. to Recover Billions It Is Owed
entries.description: The Houston-based oil company has had preliminary discussions with Venezuela’s state oil firm, PdVSA

entries.title: Russia Aims to Regain Offensive in Ukraine War With New Commander
entries.description: The appointment of Gen. Valery Gerasimov points to the possibility of a new Russian attack.

entries.title: South Korean President Says Country Could Develop Nuclear Weapons
entries.description: Yoon Suk-yeol is the first leader of the country to explicitly raise the prospect in decades, following new threats from North Korea.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia Seeks to Lure Global Miners in Bid to Overhaul Its Economy
entries.description: Rio Tinto and BHP senior executives were among those who attended a Riyadh conference focused on expanding access to critical minerals.

entries.title: U.A.E. Names Oil Chief to Run COP28 Summit
entries.description: Sultan al-Jaber is tasked with framing the agenda of this year’s U.N. climate conference, drawing criticism from environmental activists.

entries.title: Rare Earth Find in Europe Lifts Hope for Shift Toward Clean Energy
entries.description: Swedish deposit could lessen reliance on China and supply crucial minerals vital for electric cars and wind turbines.

entries.title: U.N. to Post Inspectors to All of Ukraine's Nuclear Plants
entries.description: Kyiv hopes an expanded United Nations presence will deter further Russian attacks on infrastructure.

entries.title: China's Precarious Moment: Covid Everywhere and Few Restrictions
entries.description: Parts of China’s economy are bouncing back, but Infections have skyrocketed, medical facilities are stretched to their limits and the elderly are dying. Lunar New Year holiday travel risks furthering the spread.

entries.title: Biden Administration's Big Manufacturing Push Could Transform Global Trade
entries.description: How the U.S. implements its industrial-policy measures will determine whether its allies respond with their own protectionist efforts.

entries.title: Asia, Europe Look to Collective Action to Restrain China
entries.description: Asian democracies reliant on the backstop of U.S. military power for their prosperity face a new reality now that China rivals the U.S. in areas such as advanced missiles and naval hardware.

entries.title: Egypt Plans Spending Cuts as It Faces Economic Crisis
entries.description: The International Monetary Fund extended hundreds of millions of dollars in a bailout package as the country struggles to pay off debts.

entries.title: Ukraine Says Fight for Soledar Isn't Over Despite Russian Gains
entries.description: Russian forces spearheaded by the Wagner paramilitary group have advanced into Soledar in recent days, shifting their firepower there after months of failed attempts to seize the nearby city of Bakhmut.

entries.title: Russia Finds a New Target: Maps That Still Mark Crimea as Ukraine's
entries.description: After waves of clampdowns and arrests, the Kremlin is going the extra mile to stamp out any sign of dissent, political analysts say.

entries.title: China Moves to Repair Ties With Australia by Lifting Coal Ban
entries.description: The ending of the ban is the latest indication that Beijing is taking a less confrontational approach in its foreign policy as its economy struggles.
